overview: Al-Mukhtar (Nasri Shams al-Din) invents an imaginary estate, a legal person named Rajeh, claiming that he is hostile to the estate, and that his clash with the Mukhtar always ends with Mukhtar's victory. So it protects the estate, and prevents harm to the people. Al-Mukhtar admits to his niece Rima (Fairuz) that he invented this story in order for the people of the estate to amuse, and to influence them. Rima, who was not comfortable with the story, was convinced that with a small white lie, there would be no serious harm. However, the curiosity of (Joseph Nassif) and the feast of (Elie Choueiri) of these adorable adolescents, who doubted the credibility of the story, and decided to use it to achieve personal ends, set a list of pitiless crimes, to be executed and to put the blame on Rajeh. So they released goats from the farms, in vain with the gardens, and stole small things, in addition to launching more rumors about Rajeh among the people of the estate.
title: بياع الخواتم
